page.title: 04TRANSPORT
page.content: Minera is heavily dependant on its proximity to Wrexham (about 4 miles) to supplement its own services.When interviewed, a common view was that other than basic groceries it was necessary to travel into Wrexham,on average two or three times a week.Since the railway was finally closed in the mid 1970's the only transport has been the buses of both Crosville and a local firm George Edwards.The railway was closed to passengers in 1935.This means that Minera is served by an average of two buses into Wrexham per hour and there two bus stops in the village.The main village store is at the Post office.Recently a number of community social groups have been set up such as popmobility but it was evident that the church was still quite a strong focal point for the community,
